alert.note: Alert for Coal; Hughes; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued February 15 at 9:30PM CST until February 15 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST FOR NORTHERN COAL...EAST CENTRAL PONTOTOC AND SOUTHEASTERN HUGHES COUNTIES... At 930 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 5 miles north of Centrahoma, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Tupelo and Stuart. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
